intro: Reholttumia rodigasiana, commonly known as the red-leafed hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety red leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant foliage and seasonal blooms. Reholttumia rodigasiana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
